data.title: QuickOpen fails because of case insensitivity
data.body:
Reproduce
1. Create a file, say "controlpointSagas.js"
2. Rename the file to "ControlpointSagas.js"
3. Quick open (cmd-shift-p) "contr"

You are now shown both versions of the filename. You can actually open those two files separately, but you will end up in a twilight zone. Edits in either of the file views will be saved to the actual file, but not render in the other file view. 

I haven't investigated exactly what happens, but I can tell you that trouble lies ahead. I lost half an hour of editing because I accidentally opened the small caps file and made a change. Didn't catch that this file was an old version of the real file. The real file got overwritten :(

Solution: Quick-open should NOT show files that does not exist.

Apart from this problem I'm really happy that I switched from Atom. VSCode is great!

data.title: "args" has problem with spaces
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: 16.04.1-Ubuntu

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In launch.json configurations section. Write a compicated argument to pass to the script. For example "-a filename". It doesn't work. you should do instead "-afilename" and in that way it works
2. Now try a more complicated parameter like: "--ss rose". If you try "--ssrose" it won't work.
3. Finally in my case, I have an script with an option with multiple values separated by spaces. This is imposible because this space problem. It should be: "--cc key1=value1 key2=value2" but to make it works I should change --cc for -x and it's only posible to add a value. Example: "-xkey1=value1"

data.title: [Insiders] Changing cursor position with CTRL + RIGHT does not scroll window
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider (Commit a35c7da7b)
- OS Version: Windows Server 2008 R2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have a text on one line that does not fit the current window horizontally so that you have to scroll left and right to navigate in that line
2. If you use <kbd>CTRL</kbd> + <kbd>RIGHT</kbd>, the cursor will jump to the start of each word but the window will not scroll with the cursor, so that the cursor position will be invisible after a short time.
3. If you use only the <kbd>RIGHT</kbd> key, the window will scroll with the cursor, so that is always visible

A picture (or a video) says more than words:
![scrolling problem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4070008/24443273/46f2fac6-1462-11e7-9a68-d27118fb6a7f.gif)

The Visual Studio Code instance has been started using the `--disable-extensions` parameter, so all installed extensions where deactivated.

data.title: Flakey underline/hover tooltip behavior
data.body:
Testing #23129

Not sure how else to describe it. Observations below:

### Repro 1
1. echo http://github.com from terminal
2. try hovering over output text
3. tooltip appears, but no underline

### Repro 2
1-3: Repro 1
4. hold ctrl
5. try hovering over output text
6. underline and tooltip appear, but clicking does nothing (because cmd is bound, not ctrl)

### Repro 3
1-3: Repro 1
4. hold cmd 
5. try hovering over output text
6. tooltip appears, but no underline, clicking works

### Repro 4
1-3: Repro 1
4. switch to another application
5. switch back to VS Code
6. try hovering over output text
7. both tooltip and underline appears

### Repro 5
1-3: Repro 1
4. echo https://github.com
5. try hovering over second output text
6. tooltip appears, but no underline
7. try hovering over first output text
8. neither underline nor tooltip appear

### Repro 6
1-8: Repro 5
9. switch over to another application 
10. switch back to VS Code
11. try hovering over first output text
12. underline appears, but no hover
13. try hovering over second output text
14. both hover and underline properly appear

--
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (a35c7da7b8f324c1e8cc7830173418e392542f6d, 2017-03-28T12:40:24.966Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions: none

data.title: Provide a bookmarks view

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: win7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. List all functions in current file to navigate them
2. List all bookmarks in current file to navigate them

I develop php code and I really miss navigation functions. In VS2015 (or VB6) there is a combo box that lists all functions/methods. In SciTE.RU that I use, there is a panel with function list and bookmark list. Without this features I find a navigation around my code is a true nightmare. How do you manage without them?

data.title: Visual Studio Code fails to start when there's no network connection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|CppSnippets|hars|0.0.7|
|vscode-todo-parser|minhthai|1.8.9|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.0|
|Theme-TomorrowKit|ms-vscode|0.1.3|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.1|
|java|redhat|0.0.13|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.6.1|
|guides|spywhere|0.7.0|
|unity-debug|Unity|1.1.0|
|unity-snippets|YclepticStudios|0.1.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Remove network connection;
2. Try to open a file with VSCode, or simply start the program.

VSCode works fine with internet connection and even in LAN, so I guess there's nothing to require via the internet. But when I try to start VSCode without any network connection, nothing happened. No matter how many times I click on, it won't start and I cannot find the program in task manager.

data.title: Can't get a code instance to attach to debug server
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Tried on both ubuntu 16.04 and Windows 10 (up to date)

Steps to Reproduce:

I'm simply trying to debug a debug adapter following the instructions under the contributing section of this extension https://github.com/QwertyZW/vscode-php-debug

I get to the point where I start the  vscode debugger in server mode waiting for a connection from the client vs code instance

```
node --debug-brk=12752 --nolazy out\phpDebug.js --server=4711 
Debugger listening on [::]:12752
waiting for debug protocol on port 4711
```

Spawning off a new vscode instance 

```
code testproject --extensionDevelopmentPath=.
```

From the embedded terminal, and then trying various approaches to get a connection established have all gone in vain. I tried both ubuntu 16.04 and windows 10 with no luck.

https://code.visualstudio.com/images/example-debuggers_debug-extension-server.png

I can't get to the point where it says `> accepted connection from client`

data.title: Error: Cannot start Omnisharp because Mono version >=4.0.1
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2 (1.10.2)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.3 (16D32)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install latest dotnet core cli.
1. Follow steps on https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/articles/core/tutorials/using-on-macos
1. Go to output and look for following error:

> [INFO] Starting OmniSharp at '/Users/blopez/Documents/CODEI/gitrepos/dotNetCore/tutorial/golden/golden.sln'...
[ERROR] Error: Cannot start Omnisharp because Mono version >=4.0.1 is required. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkID=534832#_20001

and this is what I got from vscode dev tools.

> shell.ts:426Cannot start Omnisharp because Mono version >=4.0.1 is required. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkID=534832#_20001: Error: Cannot start Omnisharp because Mono version >=4.0.1 is required. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkID=534832#_20001
    at /Users/blopez/.vscode/extensions/ms-vscode.omnisharp-0.3.3/out/omnisharpServerLauncher.js:59:24
    at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:103:7)

I have downloaded and installed that mono version several times from http://www.mono-project.com/download/#download-mac, close vscode and reopened, restarted my mac and same error message in vscode output.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15872584/24439573/4eacc7a2-140c-11e7-8ac9-2a86b5c8fb8a.png)

Does anyone have this error too?

Thanks in advance.

data.title: Trying to open a folder in the extension host quits without an apparent crash
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2 (also reproduces on insiders downloaded 28-03-2017)
- OS Version: Linux, Ubuntu 15.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open an extension in VSCode
2. F5 to debug
3. extension host opens, if there is a project previously loaded, the extension (in this case the Rust RLS) runs fine. If there is no project loaded, this still works from the 'welcome' screen
4. Open folder > pick any folder (not necessarily one that has a project relevant to the extension, e.g., I can open a Typescript project), open it.
5. extension host instance of VSCode immediately quits.

* there is no info in the primary VSCode window's debugger, output panel, or anywhere else I can see.
* running with --verbose I get the following messages in my terminal:
```
[main 17:40:40] Lifecycle#unload() 2
[main 17:40:40] IPC#vscode:broadcast /home/ncameron/rustls_vscode vscode:extensionTerminate true
[main 17:40:40] Lifecycle#window-before-close 2
[main 17:40:40] Lifecycle#unload() 2
[main 17:40:40] IPC#vscode:broadcast /home/ncameron/rustls_vscode vscode:extensionTerminate true
[11539:0329/174040:INFO:CONSOLE(142)] "Cannot read property 'configuration' of undefined: TypeError: Cannot read property 'configuration' of undefined
    at t.onSessionEnd (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:137:19747)
    at t.onBroadcast (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:137:2434)
    at e.invoke (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:30:26989)
    at e.fire (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:30:30524)
    at EventEmitter.<anonymous> (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:135:25974)
    at emitTwo (events.js:106:13)
    at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:191:7)", source: file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js (142)
[11539:0329/174040:WARNING:x11_util.cc(1409)] X error received: serial 12419, error_code 3 (BadWindow (invalid Window parameter)), request_code 3, minor_code 0 (X_GetWindowAttributes)
[11539:0329/174040:WARNING:x11_util.cc(1409)] X error received: serial 12471, error_code 3 (BadWindow (invalid Window parameter)), request_code 3, minor_code 0 (X_GetWindowAttributes)
[main 17:40:40] Lifecycle#window-before-close 2
[main 17:40:40] Lifecycle#window-close 2
[electron event]: fail to load,  OK
[11567:0329/174041:WARNING:ipc_message_attachment_set.cc(57)] MessageAttachmentSet destroyed with unconsumed descriptors: 0/1
```

This is a new problem - I haven't tried this for a week or two, but the last time everything worked fine. There is nothing visually different about VSCode and nothing significant has happened to my system. The last time I reproduced I was using 2.5G of 8G ram.

I have tried:

* reinstalling VSCode
* using an insiders build of VSCode
* nuking all VSCode in my .config directory
* restarting my VM
* running VSCode with no other applications running

data.title: Python: Importing packages on the fly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2 
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

Feature Request:

1. Start typing the name of a Python class or function that has not been imported. It turns red.
2. `⌥ + ⏎`  should auto-import the class or show a list of potential matches that can be added to the import list on the fly.

See [PyCharm 2016.3 Help: Importing packages on the fly](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/pycharm/2016.3/creating-imports.html#d1022065e122)

data.title: Bug: `A:A:A:A:...` in .js file locks up editor
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open new file
2. Save with .js extension
3. Type `A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:A:`

Visual studio code locks up for me when I do this. Keep repeating the A:A:A:... pattern as much as necessary, it feels like something in the syntax highlighter or possibly intellisense has exponential time complexity as this is repeated. This also happens if the string is quoted, which is strange for both theories though.

data.title: Feature: golang: package qualified symbols
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T13:56:35.908Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

When doing a "global symbol search" ('# <symbolname>' in the palette), I wish that it was possible to qualify the symbol name with the package name.  E.g., for a symbol *Sym* in package *my/package/here*, I would like to be able to type both of:
- my/package/here.Sym
- here.Sym

data.title: Encoding autoguess - weird case
data.body:
Testing #23322

- Enable autoGuessEncoding
- Open QuietLight.tmTheme in the vscode repo
- It's guessed to be EUC-JP, apparently because of a `ü` character on line 6. Other than that, it includes only ASCII characters

I can't make the same thing happen in another file by inserting `ü` characters so I don't know whether it's a jschardet bug or whether our confidence threshold is too low.

data.title: Keybinding widget prefills previous shortcuts
data.body:
Testing #23287 

- Edit a short cut, enter `Ctrl+q` in the widget
- Edit another shortcut, type a single key in the widget. The widget gets prefilled with the previous entry + whatever you type
